dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 4908 IH: Expedited Federal Permitting for California Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Garamendi introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

form.official-title: To amend title 23, United States Code, to make eligible airport-related projects and port development projects eligible for approval under State environmental laws and regulations instead of the National Environmental Policy Act of 1969, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Expedited Federal Permitting for California Act.

section.header: Program for eliminating duplication of environmental reviews

subsection.text: Section 330 of title 23, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: in subsection (j) by striking Not later than 2 years after the date of enactment of this section, and annually thereafter, the and inserting The;

subparagraph.text: in paragraph (3) by striking pilot; and

clause.text: in subparagraph (A) by striking ; and and inserting a semicolon;
by redesignating subparagraph (B) as subparagraph (D); and
by inserting after subparagraph (A) the following:

subparagraph.text: an eligible airport-related project (as such term is defined in section 40117(a) of title 49);
an eligible port development project described in section 54301(a)(3) of title 49; and

subsection.text: Not later than 1 year after the date of enactment of this Act, the Secretary of Transportation shall issue such regulations as are necessary to implement the amendments made by subsection (a).
